clinical_study.brief_title: Compliance Feasibility Study for Remote Phase 2 Cardiac Rehabilitation
clinical_study.official_title: Compliance Feasibility Study for Remote Phase 2 Cardiac Rehabilitation

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the compliance of patients in a Phase 2 (outpatient clinic based) cardiac rehabilitation program, who are offered the opportunity to perform the rehab remotely (e.g. at home, not at the clinic), using a remote monitor and smart-phone application.

detailed_description.textblock:
In spite of the fact that cardiac rehabilitation has been shown to be beneficial to patients who have had a cardiac event, such as a heart attack, only 5% of eligible patients complete this program. Some of the reasons cited include limited facility access, travel time and cost.
We are testing the hypothesis that cardiac rehab compliance will be greater if patients are offered the opportunity, and associated technology, to perform cardiac rehab anywhere.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients completing remote rehab program compared to case controls
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after cardiac rehab completion or stoppage

secondary_outcome.measure: Six minute walk test compared to case controls

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- referred to SLU cardiac rehab facility
Exclusion Criteria:
- does not own app compatible smart phone
- dementia
- syncope
- valvular disease
- life expectancy < 1 year
- non-English speaking
- unstable angina
- decompensated congestive heart failure
- ventricular arrhythmia
